title: Present Perfect Or Simple Past Tense Exercise

exercises.title: Present Perfect Or Simple Past Tense Exercise

questions.question: She ...................... to anybody in her life.
questions.description: The present perfect is more common with time expressions like ever, never, yet, before and already.

questions.question: I am sure we ……………… before.
questions.description: The present perfect is more common with time expressions like ever, never, yet, before and already.

questions.question: I ……………. a word with the manager in the morning.
questions.description: The present perfect is not used to talk about a finished event if we say when it happened.

questions.question: I ………….. two movies yesterday.
questions.description: The present perfect is not used to talk about a finished event if we say when it happened.

questions.question: How long ………………….. in love with him?
questions.description: The present perfect is used to talk about how long present situations have lasted.

questions.question: She …………… at thirty-nine.
questions.description: The present perfect is not used to talk about a finished event if we say when it happened.

questions.question: The number of unemployed ……………….. ten million.
questions.description: The present perfect is the most normal tense for giving news of recent events.

questions.question: ………………….. the people who live next door?
questions.description: The present perfect is more common with the indefinite time expressions ever, never, yet, already.

questions.question: The Defense Minister …………… a meeting with the Prime Minister yesterday.
questions.description: We do not use the present perfect tense with past time expressions.

questions.question: During the two hour meeting, they ……………. the economic situation.
questions.description: The present perfect is not used when the reference is to the past time.

questions.question: We …………….. that you have homes to let.
questions.description: Sometimes past and present perfect are both possible.

questions.question: Who …………….. the telephone?
questions.description: We use the simple past when we ask about the person responsible for a present situation.
